description: From French malingrer, from adjective malingre (“delicate, fragile”).

verbs.description: malinger (third-person singular simple present malingers, present participle malingering, simple past and past participle malingered)

entries.meaning: (transitive, intransitive) To feign illness, injury, or incapacitation in order to avoid work, obligation, or perilous risk.
examples: It is not uncommon on exam days for several students to malinger rather than prepare themselves.

entries.meaning: (transitive, intransitive) To self-inflict real injury or infection (to inflict self-harm) in order to avoid work, obligation, or perilous risk.
